words.ENTRY: <H>wait</H><audio>wait.mp3</audio><PS>verb </PS><CF>wait (for somebody/something) (to do something)</CF> <D>to remain in a particular place, and not do anything until somebody/something arrives or until something happens:</D> <X>Wait here. I'll be back in a few minutes.</X><dot><X>If I'm a little late, can you wait for me?</X><dot><X>I wrote to them a few weeks ago and I'm still waiting for a reply.</X><dot><X>I can't wait.</X> (= I am very eager.)
<H>waiter</H><audio>waiter.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a man whose job is to take orders from customers and bring food and drinks to them in a restaurant</D>

<H>walk</H><audio>walk.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>to move along on foot at a fairly slow speed:</D> <X>Our little girl is just learning to walk.</X><dot><X>"Did you drive here? " "No, I walked."</X><NR>2.</NR><D>to move on foot for exercise or pleasure:</D> <X>We walked through the park at sunset.</X>

<H>want</H><audio>want.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><D>to desire; to wish for:</D> <X>He wants a new bike.</X><dot><X>Do you want anything else?</X><dot><X>What do they want for breakfast?</X><dot><X>I don't want to discuss it now.</X>
<H>washer</H><audio>washer.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket> (usually in compounds) <D>a thing or person that washes something:</D> <X>a dishwasher</X><dot><X>a window washer</X>

watch1verbto look carefully at somebody/something: "Do you want to play, too?" "No, thanks. I'll just watch."We watch TV most evenings.Detectives are watching the suspect day and night.watch2nouncountablea small instrument that shows you what time it is. You wear it around your wrist: a digital watch
to set your watch

waynouncountablea method, style or manner of doing something; a habit: What is the best way to learn a language?I've discovered a terrific way of losing weight!There are various ways in which we can help. no way1.(informal) definitely not: "Can we have a party here?" "No way! You'll destroy the house!"2.(slang) (used to show surprise, when you find something difficult to believe): "Paul won the lottery!" "No way!"

<H>we</H><audio>we.mp3</audio><PS>pronoun</PS><D>(the subject of a verb; used for talking about the speaker and one or more other people); I and another person or other people; I and you:</D> <X>We're going to the movies.</X><dot><X>We are both thrilled with the house.</X><dot><X>We all left together.</X>
wearverb(past wore; past participle worn) to have clothes, jewelry, etc. on your body: He was wearing a suit and tie.I wear glasses for reading.Would you like to wear my necklace?

<H>weather</H><audio>weather.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>the climate at a certain place and time, how much wind, rain, sunshine, etc. there is and how hot or cold it is:</D> <X>What was the weather like in Hawaii?</X><dot><X>We'll go to the beach if the weather stays nice.</X><dot><X>The weather forecast is on after the news.</X>

Wednesdaynouncountable, uncountablethe day of the week after Tuesday and before Thursday: I'm going to see her (on) Wednesday.We usually play tennis on Wednesdays.They don't open on Wednesday.Wednesday morning/afternoon/evening/
nightlast/next WednesdayThe museum is open Wednesday through Sunday, 10 to 4:30.

weeknouncountable1.a period of seven days (usually beginning on Sunday and ending on Saturday: last week/this week/next weekHe left two weeks ago.I haven't seen her for a whole week.I play tennis twice a week.They'll be back in a week.2.the part of the week when people go to work, etc., usually from Monday through Friday: She works hard during the week.
I work a 40-hour week.

<H>weekend</H><audio>weekend.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>Saturday and Sunday:</D> <X>We're going camping this weekend. </X> (= the weekend that is coming)<dot><X>What did you do over the weekend?</X><dot><X>The bank is closed on the weekends.</X>

<H>what</H><audio>what.mp3</audio><PS>determiner;</PS> <PS>pronoun</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>(used for asking for information about somebody/something):</D> <X>What time is it?</X><dot><X>What kind of music do you like?</X><dot><X>She asked him what he was doing.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>the things (that); all the ...:</D> <X>What she says is true.</X><dot><X>I believe what she said.</X><dot><X>Is it true what she said?</X>

when1adverb1.at what time: When did she get here?
I don't know when she got here.2.(used for talking about the time at which something happens or happened): Sunday is the day when I can relax.when2conjunctionat or during the time that: He jumped up when the phone rang.When we were walking home, we saw an accident.

whereadverb; conjunction1.at, in, or to what place or position: Where can I buy a paper?I asked him where he lived.Where are you going?2.at, in, or to a place or a situation: the town where you were bornShe ran to where they were standing.
I know where we need to go.

<H>whether</H><audio>whether.mp3</audio><PS>conjunction</PS><D>(used for expressing a choice or doubt between two or more possibilities):</D> <X>I can't make up my mind whether to go or not.</X><dot><X>There was some doubt as to whether she should go.</X>

<H>which</H><audio>which.mp3</audio><PS>determiner;</PS> <PS>pronoun</PS><D>(used in questions when there are a number of people or things to choose from):</D> <X>Which piece of cake do you want?</X><dot><X>Which hand do you write with?</X><dot><X>Which is your bag?</X>

whopronoun1.(used in questions to ask somebody's name, etc.): Who did this?(informal) Who did you meet at the party?Who did you go with?2.(used in reported questions and after certain verbs): She wondered who he was.I can't remember who I asked to do this.

<H>why</H><audio>why.mp3</audio><PS>adverb</PS><D>for what reason:</D> <X>Why was she so late?</X><dot><X>I wonder why they went.</X><dot><X>"I'm not staying any longer." "Why not?"</X><dot><X>Can you tell me the reason why you are so unhappy? </X><CF>why not...</CF> <D>(used for making or agreeing to a suggestion):</D> <X>Why not order a pizza tonight?</X>
wifenouncountable (plural wives) the woman to whom a man is married

<H>window</H><audio>window.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><NR>1.</NR><D>the opening in a building, car, etc. that you can see through and that lets light in. A window usually has glass in it:</D> <X>Open the window. It's hot in here.</X><dot><X>a store window</X><NR>2.</NR><D>the glass in a window:</D> <X>to break a window</X><dot><X>to clean the windows</X>

<H>winter</H><audio>winter.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>the coldest season of the year between fall and spring:</D> <bracket>uncountable</bracket><X>It snows a lot here in the winter.</X><dot><X>a cold winter day</X><dot><bracket>countable</bracket><X>We went skiing in Colorado last winter.</X>

withpreposition1.in the company or presence of somebody/
something: I live with my parents.Are you coming with us?I talked about the problem with my teacher.2.having or carrying something: a girl with red haira house with a two-car garagethe man with a suitcase3.using something: Cut it with a knife.I did it with his help.4.(used for expressing what fills, covers, etc. something): Fill the bowl with water.5.against: He's always fighting with his brother.I usually play tennis with my sister.6.toward, concerning, or compared to somebody/something: Is he angry with us?There's a problem with my phone.

<H>wonderful</H><audio>wonderful.mp3</audio><PS>adjective</PS><D>very good; giving great pleasure:</D> <X>What wonderful weather!</X><dot><X>It's a wonderful opportunity.</X><dot><X>It's wonderful to see you again.</X>

<H>word</H><audio>word.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable</bracket><D>a sound or letter or group of sounds or letters that expresses a particular meaning:</D> <X>What's the Greek word for "computer?"</X><dot><X>Several words are spelled wrong.</X><dot><X>There are five letters in the word "apple."</X>

<H>work</H><su>1</su><audio>work.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>something that requires physical or mental effort. You usually do work because you feel you have to, not for pleasure:</D> <X>Her success is due to sheer hard work.</X><dot><X>There is still a lot of work to be done.</X><dot><X>Quit talking and get back to work!</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>what you do to earn money; the place where you go to earn money:</D> <X>It is very difficult to find work in this city.</X><dot><X>When do you start work?</X><dot><X>I go to work at 8 o'clock.</X><dot><X>The people at work gave me some flowers for my birthday.</X><H>work</H><su>2</su><audio>work.mp3</audio><PS>verb</PS><D>to do something which needs physical or mental effort; to do a job, especially in order to earn money:</D> <X>I won't pass math class unless I work harder.</X><dot><X>I've been working in the yard all day.</X><dot><X>She works for a computer company in Washington.</X><dot><X>I'd like to work as a newspaper reporter. </X><CF>work out</CF> <D>to do physical exercises in order to keep your body healthy and strong:</D> <X>Linda works out twice a week at the health club.</X>

<H>worth</H><audio>worth.mp3</audio><PS>adjective </PS><CF>worth doing, etc.</CF> <D>(used as a way of recommending or advising):</D> <X>That museum's really worth visiting if you have time.</X><dot><X>It's already nine o'clock. It's not worth going shopping now. </X><CF>worth it</CF> <D>enjoyable or useful to do or have, even if it means extra cost, effort, etc.:</D> <X>Don't cook a big meal. It isn't worth it: we're not hungry.</X>
wowinterjection(informal) (used for expressing how much you admire or are pleasantly surprised by something): Wow! What a great car!

writeverb(past wrote; past participle written) 1.to make words, letters, etc., especially on paper, using a pen, pencil, etc.: Some children can read and write before they start school.
I can't write with this pen.Write your account number on the bottom of your check.2.to create a book, story, song, etc. and write it on paper: He wrote his wife a poem.Who wrote the music for that movie?3.to write and send a letter, etc. to somebody: I'm writing to thank you for the birthday present you sent me.I wrote a letter to my son./I wrote my son a letter.I wrote to my son yesterday.
